page.title: 04RIDGEWAY ABOVE BISHOPSTONE
page.content: THIS ANCIENT TRACK TRAVERSES WILTSHIRE FROM AVEBURY IN THE SOUTH WEST VIA LIDDINGTON CASTLE TO THIS BLOCK WHERE IT CROSSES BETWEEN SU240820 AND SU258830.IT THEN CONTINUES THROUGH OXFORDSHIRE BERKSHIRE AND BUCKINGHAMSHIRE,TO IVINGHOE. IT IS ONE OF THE OLDEST WAYS IN BRITAIN AND IS STILL MUCH USED TODAY BY WALKERS AND HIKERS-THOUGH IN PLACES USE ALSO BY FARM TRACTORS HAS MADE THE GOING RUTTED AND DIFFICULT.SOMETIMES, HOWEVER, IT IS GRASSY AND PLEASANT TO WALK,IS BORDERED BY HAWTHORNS AND AFFORDS WONDERFUL VIEWS OF THE {VALE OF THE WHITE HORSE}AWAY TO THE NORTH-EAST OF BISHOPSTONE VILLAGE.
